这是一个始于16年的夏天的故事
2016年盛夏，那时的我呆在空调房看着书写着作业，但我的心思早已飞出窗外，只因电脑前父亲正在玩着一款从未见他打开过的游戏，久而久之我便知道了这个游戏叫做守望先锋，至今我还记得第一次打开它时的激动，伴随着那首恢弘而又响亮并且节奏感极强的《Victory》响起时，我的心便牢牢的拴在了这款游戏上......
我还依稀记得第一次匹配到花村时，看到了图中的樱花树时，我的两腿好像走不动道了，那风景美丽如画我至今犹记......还记得一次大事件黑影登录，当嘉年华的大屏幕被一阵强烈的信号干扰打断了视频的播放，玩家期待的Sombra出现在了荧幕上，霎时间所有的疑惑转为了惊喜，那是我见过最酷的宣传方式！后续出的绿洲城地图也是心意满满，我任然记得第一次被地图上高速行驶的骑车创飞时的惊讶与兴奋。随后便是17年开始的各种活动，周年庆，夏季运动会，万圣夜惊魂，雪国仙境，春节活动等等，更是在竞技之余为玩家提供了数不胜收的娱乐模式。
但是时间冲刷着一切，世界上没有任何事物可以经受住时间的侵蚀，我已经记不清是哪一天，我如往常般打开战网时，赫然映入我眼帘的便是姐夫（Jeff Kaplan）离职的信息，我五味杂陈，说不出来任何话，那时的我不在专注于游戏，他背后的故事我也了解甚多，但我们玩家群体又能做什么呢，最终随着各大流媒体平台的一则消息的爆出：“2022年11月17日，暴雪娱乐宣布，由于与网易目前的授权协议将于2023年1月23日到期，该公司将暂停在中国大陆的大部分暴雪游戏服务。”一切便接近了尾声。
2023年1月24日OW1正式结束，随之而来的便是全新的OW2，但是玩家真的需要它吗(PS:意指OW2)
短短几百字的短评无法让我倾尽所有，还有太多太多让全体暴雪老玩家值得回忆的事情了，漓江塔里的吴宏宇，沙塔斯城里的凯莉达克，荆棘谷底的三季稻，Undaunted公会历经377次挑战击杀恩佐斯等传奇故事......
我们讨厌的是游戏吗？我们讨厌的是唯利是图的商人，是破坏了我们这些被生活压得喘不过气的人在网络上寻求庇护的处所的人，是践踏了我们所有热爱暴雪游戏玩家的尊严的人......
我为我的青春感到惋惜，为我父亲的青春感到惋惜，为所有的暴雪玩家的青春感到惋惜...
当游戏不再纯粹，当游戏公司一心只想着钱，玩家的情怀和喜爱将会化为灰烬。When the game is no longer pure, when the game company is only focused on money, the feelings and affection of players will be reduced to ashes.
晴空无垠，乘风万里。
一位暴雪玩家

Pros: Ramattra is really fun
Cons: This game somehow has a more neglectful development team than Team Fortress 2 does. No matter where you go the game just has a competitive air around it and the whole point of the "2" in the game was nullified ever since they decided to drop the PvE content. It just seemed like a excuse to get rid of the loot boxes and switch to the battle pass which just seems far more predatory to your wallet. This game has no respect to a true free to play player and you don't feel rewarded to win on any gamemode whether its casual or competitive. It has awful matchmaking throwing you with either bronze players or grandmasters each gamemode. Games are set up in such a way where its almost designed to make a game a guaranteed win or loss. Theres no sense in accomplishment in that. While I think its cool that Overwatch is on Steam now, don't bother catching up to this game if you played this game back in the day in 2016. You aren't missing out on anything and you are better off playing other games.

Blizzard's decision to lock Overwatch story missions behind a paywall is nothing short of a slap in the face to its loyal fanbase. It's a brazen move that reeks of corporate greed, showing a total disregard for the gamers who have supported the franchise since its inception.

Let's start by recalling the initial promise. Overwatch-1 was a paid title. Gamers spent their hard-earned money, investing not just financially but emotionally in a game that, while primarily a competitive shooter, tantalized with a rich backstory and a world filled with lore. The prospect of Overwatch-2 offering PVE story missions was a shimmering beacon of hope for many. It was a chance for fans to delve deeper into the world they had grown to love, to connect with the characters on a level that went beyond just the competitive arena.

However, what transpired was a series of broken promises and missed opportunities. After years of teasing Overwatch 2, the company decided to cancel it altogether. It's a move that left many feeling betrayed. Gamers had committed countless hours, bolstering the community, creating content, and sharing their passion for the Overwatch universe, only to be left high and dry.

And now, the audacity to reintroduce story missions, but at a staggering $15 for just three missions? It's a move that feels more like a cynical cash grab than a genuine effort to provide content. For context, many AAA titles with intricate stories, hours of gameplay, and cutting-edge graphics are available at prices that make Blizzard's offering look like daylight robbery.

Overwatch's allure was never just about the gameplay. It was about the world, the characters, and the stories that tied them all together. It was about the emotional investment players made into this universe. But with this latest move, it's evident that Blizzard views its players not as fans, but as mere dollar signs.

Comparing it to other games, the value proposition is laughable. But even more than that, it's a sad reflection of how far Blizzard has strayed from its once-storied reputation of being a company that prioritized its fans. Today, it seems they are more interested in short-term financial gains than in nurturing the community that made them a gaming giant.

In conclusion, locking the Overwatch story missions behind such an exorbitant paywall is not just bad business—it's a stark betrayal of trust. Gamers deserve better, and Blizzard should know better.

我是从去年11月份玩的游戏，其实以前我就想玩守望先锋了，可是我没有电脑，所以没得玩，没有体会到你们说的守望先锋1有多好玩，多快乐。但是说实话，我觉得守望先锋2我觉得很好玩，特别是玩安娜给激素队友来力挽狂澜，还是玩坦克保护队友，打开突破口，还是玩c把对面杀玩。这些都很快乐。但是当我刚刚沉浸在守望先锋的游戏中时，中国服务器却退出了中国，暴雪你可真好，把一个好游戏弄成今天这样。我知道你们暴雪想赚钱，但是你们真的会赚钱吗？一系列恶心玩家的操作除了恶心玩家，让玩家骂，让玩家流失，真的赚到了吗，本来2016年的最佳游戏，被暴雪玩成这样，本来守望先锋有一个美好的未来，却变成今天这副模样，如果好好运营，游戏还能变成今天这样吗？游戏是好游戏，我也很喜欢玩，但是你们暴雪的一系列操作都太恶心玩家了。只能说守望先锋错就错在是暴雪游戏
